Package game

Class Round

java.lang.Object
game.Round
public class Round
extends java.lang.Object
This class is responsible for executing one single round.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Round

      public Round​(Player firstPlayer, java.util.ArrayList<Card> deck, java.util.ArrayList<Player> activePlayers, GameBoard gameBoard)
      Creates new round object.
      Parameters:
      firstPlayer - Player that begins.
      deck - Arraylist that contains the cards required for the round.
      activePlayers - Players participate in the round.
      gameBoard - Gameboard object the round belongs to.(Game gets handled there)

  • Method Details

    • play

      public void play()
      this method executes one round

    • writeResponse

      public void writeResponse​(java.lang.String message, User sender)
      Gives Messages to the Game-Thread to read. Method should be called if UserThreads get messages from clients, which have to be passed to the GameBoard-Thread.

      The response will not be accepted if the prior response has not yet been read. It is also checked if the response was sent from the currentPlayer. Otherwise it is not accepted.

      To read the response in the GameBoard-Thread, readResponse() should be called.

      Parameters:
      message - response of the player
      sender - User who replied

    • readResponse

      public java.lang.String readResponse()
      The method reads the response, which is send from a player.

      The method waits and returns, if there is a feedback from the user. Warning: If no client responds, the method does not return!

      The method is interruptible

      Returns:
      response message of the player

    • pop

      public Card pop()
      removes first card of the deck
      Returns:
      poped the removed card

    • kickPlayer

      public void kickPlayer​(Player player)
      this method kicks one player from the game.
      Parameters:
      player - player that will get kicked.

    • isTurnEnded

      public boolean isTurnEnded()
      Checks if the turn ended.
      Returns:
      whether the turn is over

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer​(Player player)
      If method is called, the given player is removed from the list of active players. If the player currently has his turn, the turn ends. The turn also ends if only one player is left.
      Parameters:
      player -
